name: Adanel
details: Adanel was a wise woman from the House of Marach. She was a daughter of Malach and his wife, Zimrahin, and the older sister of Magor. It was mentioned that Adanel had many other brothers and sisters as well, and like Magor her brother, they also might have been younger than she.

name: Ar-Sakalthôr
details: Ar-Sakalthôr was the twenty-second King of Númenor.

name: Ar-Pharazôn
details: Ar-Pharazôn, also known as Ar-Pharazôn the Golden, was the twenty-fifth and last King of Númenor. Of all the Kings of Númenor, he wielded the most power, but used it most unwisely; his desire for more eternal life caused the destruction of Númenor and the Change of the World.

name: Arahad I
details: Arahad I was the seventh Chieftain of the Dúnedain.

name: Araglas
details: Araglas was the sixth Chieftain of the Dúnedain.

name: Aragost
details: Aragost was the eighth Chieftain of the Dúnedain.

name: Ar-Gimilzôr
details: Ar-Gimilzôr was the twenty-third King of Númenor, succeeding his father Ar-Sakalthôr.

name: Ar-Adûnakhôr
details: Ar-Adûnakhôr was the twentieth King of Númenor. He was best known as the first Númenórean king to take his official name in the Adûnaic tongue instead of using the traditional Quenya form Tar-Herunúmen.[1][2]

name: Anson Roper
details: Anson Roper was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Ar-Zimrathôn
details: Ar-Zimrathôn was the twenty-first King of Númenor.

name: Aragorn I
details: Aragorn I was the fifth Chieftain of the Dúnedain.

name: Arador
details: Arador was the fourteenth Chieftain of the Dúnedain.

name: Annael
details: Annael was a Sindarin elf who lived with his people in the caves of Androth in the region of Hithlum called Mithrim, in northern Beleriand in northwestern Middle-earth. He was known for fostering Tuor in his youth.

name: Anárion
details: Anárion was the youngest son of Elendil, the High King of Gondor and Arnor. He and his brother Isildur jointly ruled Gondor, while their father dwelt in the North. Following his father's death during the Siege of Barad-dûr, and Isildur's death at the Disaster of the Gladden Fields, the kingship of Gondor was committed towards the Line of Anárion beginning with his son, Meneldil.

name: Angrod
details: Angrod was a Ñoldorin Elf, the second son of Finarfin and lord of the Ñoldor of Dorthonion. He was the father of Orodreth and subsequently grandfather of the famed Gil-galad.

name: Borin
details: Borin was a Dwarf of Durin's Folk, the second son of King Náin II and brother of Dáin I.

name: Tom Bombadil
Borlad
details: Borlad was the son of Bór, possibly the eldest of his three sons.

name: Borlach
details: Borlach was an Easterling of the First Age.

name: Bombur
details: Bombur was a Dwarf who accompanied Thorin Oakenshield and Bilbo Baggins on their journey to the Lonely Mountain. His brother Bofur and cousin Bifur also were part of the company. Bombur was by far the fattest Dwarf in the company.

name: Wilimar Bolger
details: Wilimar Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Wilibald Bolger
details: Wilibald Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Theobald Bolger
details: Theobald Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Rudibert Bolger
details: Rudibert Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Rosamunda (Took) Bolger
details: Rosamunda (Took) Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Prisca (Baggins) Bolger
details: Prisca (Baggins) Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Odovacar Bolger
details: Odovacar Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Jessamine (Boffin) Bolger
details: Jessamine Boffin was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Gundahar Bolger
details: Gundahar Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Fredegar Bolger
details: Fredegar "Fatty" Bolger was one of the small group of Hobbits who knew that Frodo had the One Ring. Fatty was a descendant of Hildibrand Took (TA 2849 - TA 2934), one of the many sons of the Gerontius Took. He was the son of Odovacar Bolger and Rosamunda Took.

name: Filibert Bolger
details: Filibert Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Adalgar Bolger
details: Adalgar Bolger (TA 2815 (SR 1215) - TA 2914 (SR 1314)) was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Bolg
details: Bolg was an Orc leader of the Misty Mountains during the late Third Age, and the son of Azog.

name: Vigo Boffin
details: Vigo Boffin was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Uffo Boffin
details: Uffo Boffin was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Tosto Boffin
details: Tosto Boffin was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Boldog (character)
details: Boldog was an Orc-captain of the host of Angband during the First Age, who is only told of in the original Lay of Leithian, and does not appear in the stories of The Silmarillion.

name: Rollo Boffin
details: Rollo Boffin was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Bofur
details: Bofur was a Dwarf of the late-Third Age. He is best known for being companions to Bilbo Baggins, Thorin Oakenshield and Gandalf on the quest to reclaim Lonely Mountain from the dragon Smaug, along with his brother Bombur and cousin Bifur.

name: Otto Boffin
details: Otto Boffin, also known as Otto the Fat, was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies Characters
details: All the characters of the film The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies.

name: Tulkas
details: Tulkas (Quenya; IPA: [ˈtulkas] - "Strong" or "Steadfast") is an Ainu, a Vala who was responsible for participating in war and the last of them to descend into Arda, coming to the aid of the others when he heard of their war with Melkor. He was also called Tulukastāz or Astaldo.

name: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey Characters
details: All characters who appear in The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey.

name: Turambar
details: Turambar was the the ninth King of Gondor.

name: Tuor
details: Tuor was an Adan of the House of Hador and great hero of Men, the only son of Huor and Rían. He was the cousin of Túrin Turambar.

name: Tulkastor
details: Tulkastor was a Elf of Tol Eressëa.

name: Elfstan Fairbairn
details: Elfstan Fairbairn was a Hobbit of the Shire, the only son of Fastred of Greenholm and Elanor Gamgee (a daughter of Sam).

name: Eönwë
details: Eönwë (Quenya; IPA: [eˈonʷe]) was a Maia serving Manwë as his herald and banner-bearer, and Chief of the Maiar along with Ilmarë.

name: Eöl
details: Eöl, always called the Dark Elf, was an Elf of Beleriand and a metallurgist of high skill. He was a Sinda who lived in Nan Elmoth, nominally part of Doriath. A great smith and friend of the Dwarves of Nogrod and Belegost, Eöl devised Galvorn, a black metal of great strength and malleability, which he fashioned into armour that he wore when going abroad. He forged two great black swords from a meteorite's metal, but had to give the sword Anglachel to Thingol as tribute for living in Nan Elmoth. The other sword, Anguirel, he kept for himself.

name: Eärwen
details: Eärwen was the daughter of Olwë and had several unnamed brothers. She was the wife of Finarfin, and mother of Finrod, Angrod, Aegnor, and Galadriel.[2]

name: Eärendur of Arnor
details: Eärendur was the tenth and last King of a united Arnor.

name: Eärnil II
details: Eärnil II was the thirty-second King of Gondor

name: Eärnur
details: Eärnur was the thirty-third and last King of Gondor until the restoration of the monarchy with Aragorn II Elessar. He took the throne upon the death of his father Eärnil II in TA 2043, and after his disappearance the Stewards of Gondor ruled in his name for many generations.

name: Eärnil I
details: Eärnil I was the thirteenth King of Gondor and the second Ship-king.

name: Eärendil
details: Eärendil (Quenya; IPA: [e.aˈrendil]) was a great Half-elven mariner who voyaged to Valinor, entreated before the Valar on behalf of the Children of Iluvatar, and carried a star across the sky at the end of the First Age. His acts had been prophesied of among the Elves centuries beforehand.[4]

name: Eärendur of Númenor
details: Eärendur was a Númenorean noblemen of the royal House of Elros.

name: Eärendur (Lord of Andúnië)
details: Eärendur was the fifteenth Lord of Andúnië and a leader of the Faithful.

name: Estë
details: Estë (Quenya; IPA: [ˈeste]) was a Ainu and a Vala who was responsible for the healing of the hurt and weary.

name: Eärendil of Gondor
details: Eärendil was the fifth King of Gondor.

name: Erestor
details: Erestor was an Elf of Rivendell and the Chief Counsellor of Elrond's household.

name: Erendis
details: Erendis, also known as The Mariner’s Wife, was the unhappy and later estranged wife of Tar-Aldarion, who was King of Númenor from SA 883 to SA 1075.

name: Estelmo
details: Estelmo was Elendur's squire during the late Second Age.

name: Óin (King of Durin's Folk)
details: Óin, was a dwarf born either in Grey Mountains (his kingdom) or the Lonely Mountain, and was the son of Glóin.

name: Saradoc Brandybuck
details: Saradoc Brandybuck, also known as "Scattergold," was a Hobbit of the Shire and the seventh Master of Buckland.

name: Sangahyando
details: Sangahyando was the great-grandson of Castamir of Gondor and along with Angamaitë, he became an important figure amongst the Haradrim and the Corsairs of Umbar.

name: Erchirion
details: Erchirion was the second son of Prince Imrahil. (His mother's name is unknown.)

name: Erellont
details: Erellont was a faithful friend of Eärendil and one of the three mariners that accompanied him on his voyages on the high seas west of Middle-earth.

name: Saradas Brandybuck
details: Saradas Brandybuck was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Salmar
details: Salmar was a Maia, creator of the Ulumúri. Made for his lord Ulmo, the Ulumúri were great conches who produced the music of the sea.

name: Salgant
details: Salgant was an Elf of Gondolin.

name: Sandyman
details: Sandyman also known as Sandyman the Miller or The Miller was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Saeros
details: Saeros was a Nandorian Elf of Doriath and one of King Thingol's high councilors.

name: Sador
details: Sador was an Edain Man and the trusted servant of Húrin, and a childhood friend of Túrin.

name: Lobelia Sackville-Baggins
details: Lobelia Sackville-Baggins was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Lotho Sackville-Baggins
details: Lotho Sackville-Baggins was a Hobbit of the the Shire of the Sackville-Baggins family.

name: Rúmil of Lórien
details: Rúmil was an Elf of Lórien and brother of Orophin and Haldir, the leading marchwarden of Lórien, during the Third Age.

name: Sagroth
details: Sagroth was an Edain of Brethil during the First Age.

name: Camellia (Sackville) Baggins
details: Camellia (Sackville) Baggins was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Rúmil (Noldo)
details: Rúmil was a knowledgeable loremaster of the Ñoldor living in the city of Tirion, in Valinor.

name: Rían
details: Rían was an Edain woman of the House of Bëor and the wife of Huor and mother of Tuor.

name: Rían (Gondor)
details: Rían was a noble Woman of Gondor.

name: Rómendacil II
details: Rómendacil II was the son of King Calmacil, the second son of King Atanatar II Alcarin and was originally named Minalcar.

name: Rómendacil I
details: Rómendacil I was the eighth King of Gondor.

name: Rudigar Bolger
details: Rudigar Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Roäc
details: Roäc was the son of Carc, and the chief of the ravens of Ravenhill near the Lonely Mountain.[1]

name: Ruffian Leader
details: The Ruffian Leader was a human criminal from somewhere near Bree. He was one of Saruman's top men in the Shire. At the beginning of The Battle of Bywater, he led 20 Ruffians to the rebel hobbits' base in Bywater. His companions were not too excited about attacking a group of hobbits much larger than their own group, despite this he attacked Merry and was shot dead by a few hobbits with bows.

name: Rudolph Bolger
details: Rudolph Bolger was a Bolger Hobbit of the Shire, husband to Cora Goodbody.

name: Andwise Roper
details: Andwise Roper, also known as Andy, was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Rufus Burrows
details: Rufus Burrows was a Hobbit from the Shire.

name: Rowan Greenhand
details: Rowan Greenhand was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: River-woman
details: The River-woman is a debated subject of J.R.R. Tolkien's world, mentioned once in The Fellowship of the Ring. It is speculated that the River-woman is a name for a single character of Goldberry's mother, or a name of an unspecified "nature spirit" or "magical being".

name: Ragnir
details: Ragnir was an Edain Man of the House of Hador.

name: Ragnor
details: Ragnor was an Edain Man of Dorthonion and one of Barahir's Outlaws.

name: Rog
details: Rog was an Elf of Gondolin during the First Age.

name: Radhruin
details: Radhruin was an Edain of the House of Bëor and one of Barahir's fellow Outlaws.

name: Ring bearers
details: All bearers of any Rings of Power.

name: Sadoc Brandybuck
details: Sadoc Brandybuck was a Hobbit from Buckland.

name: Queens
details: This category is for all the Queens of Arda

name: Radagast
details: Radagast (Adûnaic; IPA: ['radagast] - "Tender Of Beasts") the Brown, also called Aiwendil (Quenya; IPA: [ai'wendil] - "Bird-Friend") was one of the Wizards, or Istari, sent to Middle-earth to contest the will of Sauron. Originally a Maia of Yavanna, Radagast was mainly concerned with the well-being of the plant and animal worlds, and thus did not participate heavily in the War of the Ring.

name: Mrs. Proudfoot
details: Mrs. Proudfoot was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Radbug
details: Radbug was an Orc of Mordor in the Tower of Cirith Ungol who was killed by Shagrat in the battle over Frodo's Mithril Shirt. He evidently had his eyes squeezed out, as referenced by Shagrat while speaking to Snaga, and was overheard by Samwise Gamgee.[1]

name: Olo Proudfoot
details: Olo Proudfoot was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Odo Proudfoot
details: Odo Proudfoot was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Linda (Baggins) Proudfoot
details: Linda (Baggins) Proudfoot (TA 2862 (SR 1261) - TA 2963 (SR 1361)) was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Pelendur
details: Pelendur was Steward of Gondor in the year TA 1944 (Third Age).

name: Bodo Proudfoot
details: Bodo Proudfoot was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Pengolodh
details: Pengolodh (or Pengoloð) was a Loremaster of the Ñoldor who dwelt in Gondolin, to whom are attributed the Lhammas and other prominent linguistic texts from ancient Middle-earth.

name: Peter Jackson Adaptation Characters
details: Characters who appear in Peter Jackson's adaptations: The Hobbit trilogy and The Lord of the Rings film trilogy.

name: Pallando
details: Pallando (Quenya; IPA: [palˈlando]), also known as Pallando the Blue, or Rómestámo (Quenya; [ˌroːmesˈtaːmo]), was one of the five Istari or Wizards that were sent to Middle-earth to aid the Free Peoples in their struggle against Sauron.

name: Penlod
details: Penlod was an Elf of Gondolin during the First Age.

name: Otho Sackville-Baggins
details: Otho Sackville-Baggins was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Ossë
details: Ossë (Quenya or Ñoldor; IPA: [ˈosse]; from the Valarin Ošošai, Oššai) was a Maia associated with Ulmo.

name: Oropher
details: Oropher was the father of Thranduil of Mirkwood and grandfather of Legolas, and the Sindarin King of the Silvan Elves of Greenwood the Great during the Second Age.[1]

name: Oromë
details: Oromë (Quenya; IPA: [ˈorome] - "Horn-Blower" or "Sound of Horns"), also known as Aldaron (Quenya; IPA: "Horn-Blower"), Araw (Sindarin; IPA: "Horn-Blower") or Arômêz, was an Ainu, one of the Aratar and a Vala who was responsible for the hunt. He was the brother of Nessa and the husband of Vána.[3]

name: Princesses
details: This category is for all Princesses in Arda

name: Ostoher
details: Ostoher was the son and successor of King Anardil of Gondor and he became the seventh King upon Anardil's death in TA 411.

name: Precanonical characters
details: Characters of note who only appear in early writings of J.R.R. Tolkien's legendarium, who are not implied to be canonical in any published works, and who were either a forerunner to a distinct later character or were merely excluded later on and not replaced.

name: Orophin
details: Orophin was a Silvan Marchwarden from Lothlórien, and the brother of Haldir and Rúmil.

name: Oromendil
details: Oromendil was a Man of Númenór.

name: Othrod
details: Othrod was a champion of Orcs during the first age. He was killed in the Fall of Gondolin by Tuor who cleaved his helm with his axe Dramborleg. This was part of the famous onslaught which is said to have been the biggest killing of Orcs ever conducted by the Eldar.[1]

name: Orodreth
details: Orodreth was a Ñoldorin Elf of the First Age who was the second ruler of the underground city of Nargothrond in western Beleriand. He was born to a Noldorin father, Finarfin, and a Telerin mother, Eärwen, in the city of Tirion during the Years of the Trees and was the brother of Finrod Felagund, Angrod, Aegnor and Galadriel. Orodreth had an only child and daughter Finduilas with an unnamed wife. He was later killed in the Battle of Tumhalad.

name: Orchaldor
details: Orchaldor was a Man of Númenor.

name: Ori
details: Ori was a member of Thorin's Company of Dwarves and participated in the Quest of Erebor, as well as fighting in and surviving the Battle of Five Armies. He, along with his brothers Dori and Nori, were remote kinsmen of Thorin II Oakenshield.

name: Orodreth (Steward)
details: Orodreth was the sixteenth Ruling Steward of Gondor.

name: Orleg
details: Orleg was an Edain of the First Age.

name: Orcobal
details: Orcobal was an Orc chieftain of Angband during the First Age.

name: Old Noakes
details: Old Noakes was a Hobbit of the Shire and a resident of Bywater. He was a regular at the Ivy Bush inn in Hobbiton.

name: Old Man Willow
details: Tom Bombadil had power over Old Man Willow, and checked the evil in him as much as he could, or was willing to.

name: Ondoher
details: Ondoher was the thirty-first King of Gondor.

name: Ohtar
details: Ohtar was the esquire of Isildur in the early Third Age.[1]

name: Olwë
details: Olwë was an Elf of the Teleri of Aman. When he and his kin reached Aman, they chose to remain there in both Tol Eressëa and Alqualondë apart from the rest of the Elves of Aman. He became both Lord of Alqualondë and King of the Teleri.

name: Númendil
details: Númendil was the father of Amandil. He was also the grandson of Eärendur, the fifteenth Lord of Andúnië. He came to the throne after his father (whose name is unknown) and became the seventeenth Lord of Andúnië. By the time when Tar-Palantir was King of Númenor, both Lord and King desired a return to the old traditions of Númenor, and they were close friends and political allies. Tar-Palantir would at times travel to see Númendil in Andúnië, and as a Councillor of the Sceptre, Númendil would often journey to the King's seat at Armenelos.

name: Núneth
details: Núneth was a Númenórean woman and the mother of Erendis.

name: Idril
details: Idril, also called Celebrindal, was a Ñoldorin Elf of Gondolin. She was the daughter of Turgon and Elenwë, wife of the Man Tuor, and mother of Eärendil the Mariner, a Half-elven.

name: Náli
details: Náli was a Dwarf of Durin's Folk.

name: Nár
details: Nár was a Dwarf of unknown background in the Third Age. He was a friend of King Thrór in the days after the dwarven kingdom of the Lonely Mountain was taken by Smaug.

name: Húrin of Emyn Arnen
details: Húrin of Emyn Arnen was a nobleman of Gondor and the first known Steward to the King of Gondor and an ancestor of the Ruling Stewards of Gondor.

name: Náin II
details: Náin II was a Dwarf of Durin's Folk and a King of Durin's Folk.

name: Náin I
details: When his father was slain by the Balrog, Náin I attempted to destroy it, but was himself killed the following year. The remainder of Durin's Folk fled Khazad-dûm, and renamed it Moria. He was succeeded on the throne of Durin's Folk by his son Thráin I who fled to the Grey Mountains and the Lonely Mountain.[1]

name: Ibûn
details: Ibûn was a Petty-dwarf, and was the son of Mîm and brother of Khîm.

name: Hyarmendacil I
details: Hyarmendacil I was the fifteenth King of Gondor.

name: Húrin II
details: Húrin II was the fourteenth Ruling Steward of Gondor.

name: Húrin
details: Húrin, more commonly known as Húrin Thalion and Úmarth, was a hero of Men during the First Age. He was the father of the tragic Túrin Turambar. According to The Silmarillion, he was the greatest warrior of Men in the First Age.

name: Háma (Helm's son)
details: Háma was a Man of Rohan and the second son of Helm Hammerhand, who was the ninth King of Rohan.

name: Háma
details: Háma was a Man of Rohan and the doorward of the Meduseld and captain of Théoden's guard.

name: Hyarmendacil II
details: Hyarmendacil II was the twenty-fourth King of Gondor.

name: Hurin (Warden of the Keys)
details: Húrin (sometimes named Húrin the Tall) was a man of Gondor during the events of the War of the Ring. He lived in Minas Tirith and there he held the title of Warden of the Keys. He was also a Lord of the city and a captain of Gondor's armies. For a short while he also served as the Steward of the city when Faramir was in the Houses of Healing and Imrahil had ridden out to the Black Gate of Mordor with Aragorn and the Armies of the West.

name: Huan
details: Huan was a great wolfhound of the First Age. He was given by the Vala Oromë the Hunter to his friend Celegorm, one of the Sons of Fëanor. Huan was as large as a small horse, and accompanied Celegorm on his huntings. When the Ñoldor under Fëanor rebelled, Huan went with his master to Middle-earth.[2]

name: Hundad
details: Hundad was a noble Man in the House of Haleth. His father was Hundar, and his son was Hardang.

name: Huor
details: Huor was an Edain and a hero of Men during the First Age.

name: Hunthor
details: Hunthor was an Edain of the House of Haleth, and was the only Man to accompany Túrin when Túrin went to slay Glaurung.

name: Húrin I
details: Húrin I was the fifth Ruling Steward of Gondor.

name: Tobold Hornblower
details: Tobold Hornblower also known as Old Toby was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Hugo Bracegirdle
details: Hugo was the son of Bruno Bracegirdle, and was born in SR 1350.[1]

name: Holman Greenhand
details: Holman Greenhand was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Tanta Hornblower
details: Tanta Hornblower was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Horn
details: Horn was a Man of Rohan who died in the Battle of the Pelennor Fields.

name: Náin (father of Dáin II Ironfoot)
details: Náin was a Dwarf of Durin's Folk.

name: Holman Cotton
details: Holman Cotton, also known as "Long Hom" was a Hobbit of the Shire and a member of the Cotton family.

name: Tobias Hornblower
details: Tobias Hornblower was a friend of the Sackville-Baggins and a shirriff of the Shire. In TA 3018 he met a Black Rider on the road to Hobbiton and was killed. He was married to Rosamunda Chubb and had three sons.

name: Nori
details: Nori was a Dwarf of Durin's folk who lived in the northern Blue Mountains in Thorin's Halls and later the restored Lonely Mountain. He had two brothers named Dori and Ori, and was a remote kinsman of Thorin Oakenshield. His hood was purple, he played the flute, and he was very fond of regular and plentiful meals like his hobbit friend, Bilbo Baggins.

name: Nurwë
details: Nurwë was an elf from Cuiviénen who refused the summons of the Valar.

name: Nolondil
details: Nolondil was the third son and youngest child of Vardamir Nólimon, the second King of Númenor.

name: Nimrodel
details: Nimrodel was an Nandorin Elf Maiden of Lórien of the Third Age.

name: Nob
details: Nob was a Hobbit of Bree and a servant at The Prancing Pony.

name: Nimloth (elf)
details: Nimloth was an Elf of Doriath during the First Age. She was the daughter of Galathil, son of Galadhon, the son of Elmo. Elmo was the brother of Olwë and Elwë, making her a kinswoman of King Thingol.

name: Nienna
details: Nienna (Quenya; IPA [niˈenna] or [niˈjenna] - "Weeping" or "She Who Weeps") was an Ainu, one of the Aratar and a Vala who was responsible for the mercy and grief spread across Arda. She was the sister of Mandos and Irmo and had no spouse. Her part in the Music of the Ainur was one of deep sadness, from which grief entered the world at its beginning.[1] She had dominion over the Halls of Nienna, which were on the western edge of Valinor, looking over the sea.

name: Nielíqui
details: Nielíqui was a Vala and the daughter of Oromë and Vána in the earlier forms of the legendarium.[1]

name: Nerdanel
details: Nerdanel, also known as Nerdanel the Wise, was the daughter of the Ñoldorin smith Mahtan and the wife of the infamous Fëanor the High Prince of the Noldor, eldest son of Finwë.

name: Nina Lightfoot
details: Nina Lightfoot was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Nellas
details: Nellas was an Elf Maiden of Doriath during the First Age.

name: Narvi
details: Narvi (fl. SA 750?)[1] (originally Ngarvi, Ñarvi) was a dwarf of Khazad-dûm (Moria) during the Second Age.

name: Nauglath
details: The Nauglath (named in differing versions Nautar, Nauglir, and Nornwaith[1]) are one of two Wicked dwarf clans appearing in The Book of Lost Tales. They were ruled by Naugladur of Nogrod and were related to the Indrafangs (Longbeards).

name: Nessa
details: Nessa (Quenya; IPA: [ˈnessa] - "Young") was an Ainu and a Valië and was ranked the least among the Valar. She was notable for her speed, being fast "as an arrow in movement", for which reason she was called Nessa the Swift.

name: Naugladur
details: Naugladur was the Lord of Nogrod; the King of the Wicked dwarves of Nogrod in the earlier forms of the legendarium and in Beren and Lúthien (2017).

name: Narmacil II
details: Narmacil II was the twenty-ninth King of Gondor and the son of Telumehtar.

name: Narmacil I
details: Narmacil I was the seventeenth King of Gondor after the death of his father Atanatar II Alcarin in TA 1226. Like Falastur before him, he was notable for his childlessness.

name: Nessanië
details: Nessanië was a noble Woman of Númenór.

name: Mîm
details: Mîm, or Mîm the Dwarf[1], was a Petty-dwarf of the First Age and possibly the last of the Petty-dwarves. He was mostly a part in the adventures of Turin Turambar.

name: Míriel
details: Míriel Therindë [Quenya: Þerindë] or Míriel Serindë was the first wife of Finwë, the High King of the Ñoldor and the mother of Fëanor. Miriel's hair was described as being silver in appearance, an unusual color for one of the Ñoldor.[2] She was highly skilled in the art of weaving and needlework, and thus her amilessë (mother-name) was Þerindë, the Broideress.[4]

name: Muzgash
details: Muzgash was an Orc of Cirith Ungol.

name: Nahar
details: Nahar was the horse of Oromë the Vala. Nahar was said to be as brilliant as new snow in daylight, and as glimmering as silver in the moonlight.

name: Hundar
details: Hundar was a Man of the Haladin, and a member of the House of Haleth.

name: Morwë
details: Morwë, along with Nurwë, refused the summons of the Valar to Aman.

name: The Moth
details: The Moth is the name given to a non-canonical small moth that comes to Gandalf occasionally, forewarning that Eagles are coming, or used by him to summon them.

name: Mouth of Sauron
details: The Mouth of Sauron was a living man, the herald and messenger of Sauron, the Lieutenant of the Dark Tower of Barad-dûr in Middle-earth and one of the most devoted and dark servants of Sauron at the time of the War of the Ring. His true name had been forgotten, even by himself.

name: Morwen
details: Morwen was an Adan of the House of Bëor, the daughter of Baragund and the wife of Húrin Thalion and the mother of Túrin Turambar.[1]

name: Minohtar
details: Minohtar was a noble Man of Gondor.

name: Minor characters (The Lord of the Rings)
details: This category is for minor characters in The Lord of the Rings.

name: Mithrellas
details: Mithrellas was a Silvan Elf who, according to the tradition of the House of Angelimir, accompanied Nimrodel from Lothlórien on her journey to the southern havens. Mithrellas, it is said, became lost in the woods of Belfalas, where she was found by Imrazôr the Númenórean, who married her. So Elvish blood entered the line of the Princes of Dol Amroth, it was claimed, and her son Galador became the first of the long line of Princes. Mithrellas also bore Imrazôr a daughter, Gilmith.[1]

name: Minardil
details: Minardil was the twenty-fifth King of Gondor.

name: Merimas Brandybuck
details: Merimas Brandybuck was a Hobbit from Buckland.

name: Morwen (Gondor)
details: Morwen was a noblewoman of Gondor.

name: Menegilda Goold
details: Menegilda Goold was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Minastan
details: Minastan was a man of Gondor, born sometime after TA 1516, who was the second son of Minardil and father of Tarondor. His elder brother Telemnar was King of Gondor for only two years until he died in the Great Plague of 1636. Minastan might have died too in that Plague, or else he died earlier. [1]

name: Meneldil
details: Meneldil was the third King of Gondor.

name: Melkor
details: Melkor (Quenya; IPA: "He who arises in might"), later known predominantly as Morgoth (Sindarin; IPA: "Black Foe of the World")[1], was the first Dark Lord, and the primordial source of evil in Eä.

name: Meleth
details: Meleth was an Edain Woman of Brethil during the First Age.

name: Meneldor
details: Meneldor was a Great Eagle who dwelt at the Eagles Eyrie, at the north half of the Misty Mountains.

name: Melian
details: Melian (Sindarin IPA: [ˈmeljan]) was a Maia of the race of the Ainur, Queen of Doriath and mother of Lúthien Tinúviel.

name: Men
details: Men (that is, Atani) were one of several races inhabiting Arda. They are the humans of Middle-earth, and the second of the Children of Ilúvatar.

name: Meril-i-Turinqi
details: Meril-i-Turinqi was the Queen of the island Tol Eressëa in the earlier forms of the Middle-earth legendarium.

name: Mauhúr
details: Mauhúr was an Uruk-hai of Isengard in the late Third Age during the War of the Ring.

name: Non-canonical characters
details: For all non-canonical characters, such as those who appear only in RPGs, games, or films. Non-canonical characters are any characters which were not created by J.R.R. Tolkien, usually coming from one of the forms of media listed above. For more on what is canon and what is not, see LOTR:Canon.

name: Master of Lake-town
details: The Master of Lake-town or "The Master" was the original leader of Lake-town when Bilbo Baggins and his companions arrived. He is described as being greedy, but not undeserving of his position in terms of intelligence and charisma. He was an acquaintance of Bard the Bowman, and the captain of the town archers, allowing him to remain in Lake-town while the Lakemen recovered from their ordeal with Smaug.

name: May Gamgee (Hobson's daughter)
details: May Gamgee was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Marhwini
details: Marhwini was the first lord of the people who became known as the Éothéod, later the Rohirrim.

name: Marhari
details: Marhari was a Northman noble of the Kingdom of Rhovanion and a descendent of King Vidugavia.

name: Marcho
details: Marcho was a Fallohide-hobbit adventurer and one of the founders of the Shire.

name: Mardil Voronwë
details: Mardil Voronwë was a noble Man of Gondor from the House of Húrin during the mid-Third Age in Middle-earth and was the following:

name: Marach
details: Marach was an Edain and the first lord, chieftain of his people who were numerous compared to the other houses of the Edain.

name: Manthor
details: Manthor was a Man of Brethil during the First Age. He was descended from Halmir, who was the fourth chieftain of the Haladin and the great-grandfather of Manthor through his mother Meleth.[1]

name: Manwë
details: Manwë (Quenya; IPA: [ˈmanʷe] - "Blessed One") was the leader of the Ainur, one of the Aratar, King of the Valar, husband of Varda, brother of the Dark Lord Melkor, and King of Arda. He was also known as Súlimo, Mânawenûz or Valahiru and lives atop Mount Taniquetil in Valinor, the highest mountain of the world. The winds and airs are his servants. He was the greatest in authority, but not in power, of all the Valar, Melkor being more powerful. He was however the greatest of the Aratar, among whom Melkor was not counted.

name: Manwendil
details: Manwendil was the third child and second son of Elros Tar-Minyatur, the first King of Númenor.

name: Man in the Moon
details: In Middle-earth folklore the Man in the Moon is described as being an old being who secretly hid on the island of the Moon, and built his minaret there. Combined with the Elven lore, as presented in the legendarium of The Silmarillion, the Man in the Moon of the Hobbits' tales must have his origins in the legend of Tilion the Maia.

name: Malvegil
details: Malvegil was the sixth King of Arthedain.

name: Mandos
details: Mandos (Quenya; IPA: [ˈmandos] - "Prison-Fortress") is an Ainu, one of the Aratar and a Vala who is responsible for the judgement of the Spirits (or Fëa) of all Elven dead. He also had responsibility for pronouncing the dooms and judgments of Eru Ilúvatar under Manwë. His real name is Námo (Quenya; IPA: "Ordainer" or "Judge") but was later known by the Elves as Mandos after his sacred Halls of Mandos, over which he presided, and where Elves would go when killed.

name: Holfast Gardner
details: He was born in Bag End some time during the Forth Age.

name: Marroc Brandybuck
details: Marroc Brandybuck  was a Hobbit from Buckland.

name: Marmadas Brandybuck
details: Marmadas Brandybuck was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Hirluin
details: Hirluin, known fully as Hirluin the Fair or Hirluin of the Green Hills, was a Man of Gondor, and the Lord of Pinnath Gelin‎, who came to the aid of Minas Tirith during the War of the Ring.

name: Hob Hayward
details: Hob Hayward was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Hildigard Took
details: Hildigard was the daughter of Adamanta (Chubb) Took and Gerontious "The Old" Took. She died young.[1]

name: Hirgon
details: Hirgon was an errand-rider of Gondor during the War of the Ring.

name: Hobson Gamgee
details: Hobson 'Roper' Gamgee was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Herumor
details: Herumor was a Black Númenórean lord.

name: Herucalmo
details: Herucalmo was the consort to the Ruling Queen Tar-Vanimeldë of Númenor.[1]

name: Hob Gammidge
details: Hob Gammidge was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Hild
details: Hild was a noble woman who lived in Rohan.

name: Herumor (Fourth Age)
details: Herumor was a leader of a secret cult growing in Gondor during the Fourth Age. He was an adept of Darkness.

name: Herion
details: Herion was the third Ruling Steward of Gondor.

name: Herefara
details: Herefara was a Rohirrim warrior who served King Théoden during the War of the Ring. He fought and died in the Battle of the Pelennor Fields.

name: Heavenly Beings
details: All items (6)

name: Helm Hammerhand
details: Helm Hammerhand was the ninth King of Rohan, and the end of the first line of its Kings. His rule was plagued by war with the Dunlendings that attempted to usurp his rule of Rohan.

name: Herubrand
details: Herubrand was a Rohirrim warrior who served was a guard of King Théoden. He perished during the Battle of the Pelennor Fields, and his name was remembered in the poem Song of the Mounds of Mundburg.

name: Mat Heathertoes
details: Mat Heathertoes was a Man of Bree who died in the year 3019 of the Third Age, along with two other Men and two Hobbits.

name: Hathol
details: Hathol was an Edain, Lord of the Third House of the Edain or the House of Marach. He was the son of Magor and father of Hador. He was most likely born within the last century of the First Age. Although it is not known, it was likely that he died in the War of Wrath.

name: Hendor
details: Hendor was an Elf of Gondolin.

name: Hardang
details: Hardang was a Man, and a Chieftain of the Men of Brethil during the First Age.

name: Henderch
details: Henderch was a Man of Númenor, known for being a sailor on the ships of Aldarion and a servant to his King. He accompanied Prince Aldarion on the ship Hirilondë during his many journeys to Middle-earth.

name: Hathaldir
details: Hathaldir, also called Hathaldir the Young, was an Adan of the House of Bëor.

name: Hareth
details: Hareth was an Edain woman of the House of Haleth.

name: Harding
details: Harding was a Man of Rohan.

name: Hatholdir
details: Hatholdir was a Man of Númenór.

name: Hallas (Steward)
details: Hallas was the thirteenth Ruling Steward of Gondor.

name: Halmir
details: Halmir was an Edain Man of Brethil during the First Age.

name: Haleth
details: Haleth was the daughter of Haldad, leader of the Haladin (or Halethrim), one of the Three Houses of the Edain.

name: Hallatan
details: Hallatan was a noble Man of Númenor.

name: Handir
details: Handir, son of Haldir was the second to last Chieftain of the Haladin and a Lord of the Mannish settlements of the land of Brethil.

name: Halfred of Overhill
details: Halfred of Overhill was a Hobbit of the Shire and a member of the Gamgee family.

name: Hamfast of Gamwich
details: Hamfast of Gamwich was a Hobbit of the Shire, and founder of the Gamwich family.

name: Hallacar
details: Hallacar was a Númenórean nobleman; the son of Hallatan of Hyarastorni and husband of Tar-Ancalimë, the first Ruling Queen of Númenor.

name: Haldir (Lorien)
details: Haldir was an Elf of Lothlórien, probably a Silvan Elf, and a marchwarden who guarded the forest's northern borders. When the Fellowship of the Ring arrived in Lórien, he became their guide to Caras Galadhon. He and his companions are described as wearing grey hooded cloaks and residing on platforms or flets.

name: Haleth (Helm's son)
details: Haleth was a Man of Rohan and the first son of Helm Hammerhand.

name: Haldir (Haladin)
details: Haldir was an Edain of the House of Hador and a Chieftain of the Haladin.

name: Halbarad
details: Halbarad was a Dúnadan Ranger of the North, and one of Aragorn's comrades during the weeks leading up to Sauron's final demise.[1]

name: Haldar
details: Haldar (born FA 341 - died FA 375) was the son of Haldad, leader of the Haladin (House of Haleth), twin brother to Haleth and the father of Haldan. [1] He came to the Beleriand with his family and his people in the year 420.

name: Hador
details: Hador Goldenhead, known also as Hador Lórindol, was a great chieftain of the Edain in the First Age of Middle-earth, and a revered Edain among many of the greatest Elf-friends of the Eldar. He became the first Lord of Dor-lómin and was accounted mighty even among the Eldar. Hador and his wife Gildis had three children: Glóredhel the first child and only daughter, Galdor the second child and elder son, and Gundor the last child and younger son.

name: Haldad
details: Haldad was a leader of the Haladin) in Thargelion.

name: Gálmód
details: Gálmód was a Man of Rohan and the father of Gríma Wormtongue, who was the chief adviser to King Théoden during the War of the Ring.

name: Gwaihir
details: Gwaihir, also known as Gwaihir the Windlord, was the greatest of the Great Eagles during the Third Age. He is best known for his deeds during the events of The Hobbit and the War of the Ring.

name: Hador (Steward)
details: Hador was the seventh Ruling Steward of Gondor.

name: Guthláf
details: Guthláf was the banner-bearer of King Théoden of Rohan.

name: Gundor
details: Gundor was an Edain Man of Dor-lómin. Younger brother of Galdor the Tall and son of Hador Lórindol. Perished with his father in the Dagor Bragollach (the Battle of Sudden Flame).

name: Gárulf
details: Gárulf was a Man of Rohan during the Third Age.

name: Gróin
details: Gróin was the son of Farin, was a Dwarf of Durin's Folk.

name: Grishnákh
details: Grishnákh was an Orc captain from Mordor who led a host of Orcs to join the Uruk-hai who were taking Merry and Pippin across the plains of Rohan to Mordor.

name: Grimbeorn
details: Grimbeorn, also known as Grimbeorn the Old, was Beorn's son.

name: Guardians of Middle-Earth Characters
details: This category is for characters in Guardians of Middle-earth.

name: Grór
details: Grór was the founder of the Dwarven realm in the Iron Hills and its first lord.

name: Gwindor
details: Gwindor was an Elf of Nargothrond during the First Age. He was the son of Guilin and a Prince of Nargothrond.

name: Gundabald Bolger
details: Gundabald was the son of Gundahad Bolger and his unnamed wife. At some point, he married Salvia Brandybuck, and together they had at least one son, Theobald.[1]

name: Grimbold
details: Grimbold was a Rohan commander from Grimslade. He led the Riders of Rohan during the First Battle of the Fords of Isen along with Elfhelm and Théodred and killed many Orcs. Soon he had to retreat due to the death of Théodred. He distinguished himself during the Second Battle of the Fords of Isen by holding off a large army of Orcs for an extended period of time, then staging a retreat with minimal losses when enemy forces arrived.

name: Guilin
details: Guilin was a noble Elf of Nargothrond and the father of Gelmir and Gwindor.

name: Mallor
details: Mallor was the third King of Arthedain.

name: Halfred Greenhand
details: Halfred Greenhand was a gardener and a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Malva "Headstrong" Brandybuck
details: Malva "Headstrong" Brandybuck was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Grithnir
details: Grithnir was an Edain of the House of Hador and a Man of Hurin's household during the First Age. He and his companion Gethron were best known for serving as escorts to the young Túrin on his journey to Doriath.

name: Rose Greenhand
details: Rose Greenhand was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Hending Greenhand
details: Hending Greenhand was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Holman the Greenhanded
details: Holman the Greenhanded was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Major characters (The Lord of the Rings)
details: This category is for Major characters in The Lord of the Rings.

name: Mairen
details: Mairen was a noble Woman of Númenór.

name: Maglor
details: Maglor was the second son of Fëanor and Nerdanel. He was the greatest poet and minstrel of the Ñoldor and was said to have inherited more of his mother's gentler temperament.

name: Mahtan
details: Mahtan was a renowned Ñoldorin metallurgist of Aman and the father of Nerdanel, the wife of Fëanor.

name: Maeglin
details: Maeglin was an Elf, the son of Eöl the "Dark Elf" and Aredhel daughter of Fingolfin. He lived during the First Age of the Sun in Middle-earth, and was a lord of the hidden Elven kingdom of Gondolin. He became infamous for his betrayal of the location of the city of Gondolin to the Dark Lord Morgoth.

name: Malantur
details: Malantur was a Númenorean noble, the son of Caliondo, son of Eärendur. He lived during the late first millennium of the Second Age.

name: Lúthien
details: Lúthien, also known as Tinúviel, was an Elf Maiden of Doriath, the wife of Beren Erchamion, and the most beautiful of all the Children of Ilúvatar to ever live. Her love of the mortal Edain Beren, for which she was prepared to risk everything, including her life, was legendary and lamented forever in song and story. She and Beren braved Morgoth's horrors, eventually winning the Silmaril and the respect of Thingol. Though their actions later resulted in both their deaths, their deeds won them the pity of Mandos and a second life in Middle-earth. [2] Her romance with Beren was one of the great stories of the Elder Days that were told for many ages after she lived.

name: Malach
details: Malach (named fully Malach Aradan) was an Edain Man of the House of Marach in the First Age.

name: Maedhros
details: Maedhros, also called Maedhros the Tall,[5] was one of the princes of the Ñoldor, the eldest of the seven Sons of Fëanor and head of the House of Fëanor following the death of his father in Middle-earth. He was extraordinarily renowned for his skill both as a warrior and as a diplomat. For hundreds of years, he led his House against the forces of Morgoth but the Oath that he and his six brothers had sworn to recover the Silmarils constrained him and ultimately led to his death.

name: Mablung
details: Mablung, also known as Mablung of the Heavy Hand, was a Sindarin elf who served in the army of King Elu Thingol of Doriath, as a captain and marchwarden.

name: Lóni
details: Lóni was a Dwarf of unknown lineage.

name: Magor
details: Magor was the son of Malach Aradan and Zimrahin Meldis, and the younger brother of his sister Adanel. Through his father Malach, Magor was the grandson of Marach himself for his father was the eldest son of Marach. It was told that Magor was known as the 'Sword', and later his son Hathol was called the 'Axe'. He was of the House of Marach, the greatest and Third House of the Edain.

name: Lugdush
details: Lugdush was an Uruk-hai of Isengard.

name: Lungorthin
details: Lungorthin was a Balrog mentioned in earlier versions of The Silmarillion.

name: Lothíriel
details: Lothíriel was a princess of Dol Amroth in Middle-earth, daughter of Prince Imrahil, and later Queen of Rohan.

name: Mablung the Ranger
details: Mablung was a Ranger of Ithilien, and was one of the most trusted of Faramir's men.

name: Brytta Léofa
details: Brytta, also known as Léofa, was the eleventh King of Rohan.

name: Lorgan
details: Lorgan was the chief of the Easterlings in Hithlum after the Nirnaeth Arnoediad, with claims on Dor-Lómin as well.

name: Léod
details: Léod was a Lord of the Éothéod and the father of Eorl the Young.

name: Lindo
details: Lindo was a Ñoldor Elf of Tol Eressëa and the owner and/or keeper of the Cottage of Lost Play.

name: Lenwë
details: Lenwë was a Teleri Elf, founder of the Nandor and the father of Denethor.

name: Lug
details: Lug was an Orc chieftain during the First Age. He was killed in the Fall of Gondolin when Tuor cut him to the knees. In that onslaught it is said more orcs were killed than in any other battle (so far) between Orcs and Elves.[1]

name: Legolas
Legolas (elf of Gondolin)
details: Legolas was a member of the House of the Tree and was one of Galdor's scouts. He escaped the Fall of Gondolin with its survivors and led them across the Cristhorn.[1] After the First Age he moved to Tol Eressëa where he remained ever after, going by the name Laiqalassë.[2]

name: Larnach
details: Larnach was an Edain Man of Brethil.

name: Lindórië
details: Lindórië was a Woman of Númenor.

name: Lindissë
details: Lindissë was a woman of Númenór.

name: Lalaith
details: Urwen, more commonly known as Lalaith, was an Edain child of the House of Hador, the second child of Húrin and Morwen Eledhwen and sister of Túrin Turambar during the First Age.

name: Kings
details: This category is for the Kings of Arda.

name: Khîm
details: Khîm was a Petty-dwarf, was the son of Mîm and brother of Ibûn.
I am... a Child of God, male, teenaged, American, a Tolkienite, a Paralegal student, a Celtic Enthusiast,

name: Ivriniel
details: Ivriniel was a noble woman of the principality Dol Amroth.

name: Lagduf
details: Lagduf was an Orc of the Tower of Cirith Ungol.

name: Isilmë
details: Isilmë was the second daughter of Tar-Elendil, the fourth King of Númenor.

name: Landroval
details: Landroval was one of the Great Eagles of Middle-earth and the brother of Gwaihir the Windlord.

name: Isumbras Took IV
details: Isumbras Took IV was a Hobbit of the Shire and its twenty-eighth Thain. He was also one of the many uncles of Bilbo Baggins.

name: Isilmo
details: Isilmo was a Man of Númenor.

name: Isildur
details: Isildur was the oldest son of Elendil and brother to Anárion. As the High King of Gondor and Arnor, Isildur and his brother Anarion jointly ruled Gondor in the South, while their father dwelt in the North.

name: Ivorwen
details: Ivorwen was the mother of Gilraen, the grandmother of Aragorn and the wife of Dírhael.

name: Isengar Took
details: Isengar Took was a Hobbit of the Shire and one of the many uncles of Bilbo Baggins.

name: Isembold Took
details: Isembold Took was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Ioreth
details: Ioreth was a woman of Gondor, originally from the province of Lossarnach and a healer.

name: Irmo
details: Irmo (Quenya; IPA: [ˈirmo] - "Desirer" or "Master of Desires") was an Ainu, and a Vala who was responsible for the creation of dreams and desires as well as visions too. He was more commonly known as Lórien, after the name of his dwelling place. Irmo-Lórien was the younger brother of Námo who also like his brother was commonly known as Mandos the name of his dwelling place, and also the brother of Nienna (Lady of Pity and Mourning).

name: Isengrim Took III
details: Isengrim Took III was a Hobbit of the Shire and the twenty-seventh Thain.

name: Iorlas
details: Iorlas (b. TA 2990) was a man who lived in Minas Tirith. He was the uncle of Bergil.

name: Ingwë
details: Ingwë was a Vanyar Elf, the King of the Vanyar and the High King of the Elves.

name: Indor
details: Indor was an Edain Man of Dor-lómin.

name: Inzilbêth
details: Inzilbêth was a noble Woman of Númenór and the wife of Ar-Gimilzôr, the twenty-third King of Númenor.

name: Inhabitants of Tol Eressëa
details: All items (7)

name: Ingwion
details: Ingwion was the son of Ingwë, the High King of the Elves.

name: Iminyë
details: Iminyë was an Elf of Cuiviénen.

name: Imin
details: Imin was an Elf of Cuiviénen. He was best known as the first Elf to awake.

name: Indis
details: Indis was a Vanyar Elf of Valinor.

name: Eru Ilúvatar
details: Eru is the supreme deity of Arda. He was the single creator, above the Valar, but has delegated almost all direct action within Eä to the Ainur, including the shaping of the Arda.

name: Imrahil
details: Imrahil, also known as Prince Imrahil, was the twenty-second Prince of Dol Amroth. He had two older sisters, Ivriniel and Finduilas. His daughter Lothiriel wedded Éomer, King of Rohan, in the last year of the Third Age.

name: Imrazôr
details: Imrazôr was a Prince of Belfalas in Gondor. He was traditionally believed to be the sire of the Princes of Dol Amroth.

name: Erling Greenhand
details: Erling Greenhand was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Gothmog (Balrog)
details: Gothmog (Sindarin IPA: [ˈɡoθmoɡ] - "Strife and Hate") was the Lord of Balrogs during the First Age, and the greatest Balrog ever to walk Middle-earth. As the High Captain of Angband, his only equal in rank was Sauron. He fought many battles in the name of his master Morgoth, and was personally responsible for killing two of the High Kings of the Ñoldor.

name: Imlach
details: Imlach was an Edain Man of the House of Marach.

name: Gram
details: Gram was the eighth King of Rohan.

name: Gothmog (Lieutenant of Morgul)
details: Gothmog was the lieutenant of the Witch-king in the Third Age, from Minas Morgul, notably at the Battle of the Pelennor Fields.

name: Gostir
details: Gostir was a dragon only known by name.[1]

name: Gorlim
details: Gorlim was one of the companions of Barahir and his band of outlaws in Dorthonion.

name: Bell (Goodchild) Gamgee
details: Bell Gamgee, born Bell Goodchild was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Gorgol
details: Gorgol was an Orc chieftain, also called The Butcher, who lived in Beleriand during the First Age.

name: Gorbag
details: Gorbag was an Orc captain of Cirith Ungol during the Third Age, originally from Minas Morgul.

name: Togo Goodbody
details: Togo Goodbody was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Lily (Baggins) Goodbody
details: Lily (Baggins) Goodbody was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Gorhendad (Oldbuck) Brandybuck
details: Gorhendad Brandybuck was a Hobbit of the Shire and the eleventh Thain of the Oldbuck line, as well as being the first Master of Buckland.

name: Hanna (Goldworthy) Brandybuck
details: Hanna Brandybuck (née Goldworthy) was a Hobbit of the Shire and Buckland.

name: Golfimbul
details: Golfimbul was a goblin chieftain of Mount Gram, the fortress of Goblins in the Ettenmoors, who led his band in an invasion of the Shire. He was defeated and beheaded at the Battle of Greenfields by Bandobras "Bullroarer" Took. The manner of his death at Bullroarer's hands is said to have inspired the game of Golf.

name: Goldwine
details: Goldwine was the sixth King of Rohan.

name: Gorbulas Brandybuck
details: Gorbulas Brandybuck was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Goldberry
details: Goldberry, also called The River-daughter, was the wife of Tom Bombadil in the Old Forest at the edge of Buckland.

name: Harry Goatleaf
details: Harry Goatleaf was the gatekeeper of Bree's western gate during the time of the War of the Ring.

name: Glorfindel
details: Glorfindel was one of the mighty of the Firstborn (the Elves), and was once the Lord of the House of the Golden Flower in Gondolin. After his death, he was re-embodied by the Valar to act as an emissary.

name: Glóin (King of Durin's Folk)
details: King Glóin was a dwarf, the son of Thorin I and King of Durin's Folk. Glóin had one son, Óin.

name: Glóin
details: Glóin son of Gróin was one of the Dwarves of Thorin II Oakenshield's company who set out to reclaim the Lonely Mountain in the Quest of Erebor. He was also the father of Gimli, who became a member of the Fellowship of the Ring.

name: Gléowine
details: Gléowine was a Rohirrim soldier who served as Théoden's minstrel during the War of the Ring.

name: Glóredhel
details: Glóredhel was an Edain woman of the House of Hador.

name: Glaurung
details: Glaurung was the first terrestrial, fire-breathing Dragon in Middle-earth. He was known as the Father of Dragons.

name: Golasgil
details: Golasgil was the Lord of Anfalas during the War of the Ring.

name: Gimli (Elf)
details: Long a captive slave in the stronghold of Tevildo, Gimli possessed an extraordinary power of hearing for which he became famous to the elves of Tol Eressëa in later times.

name: Girion
details: Girion was the last Lord of Dale, who ruled from TA 2763 to his death in TA 2770.

name: Gimilkhâd
details: Gimilkhâd was the younger son of Ar-Gimilzôr and father of Ar-Pharazôn.

name: Gormadoc "Deepdelver" Brandybuck
details: Gormadoc "Deepdelver" Brandybuck was a Hobbit of the Shire and the second Master of Buckland.

name: Gilraen
details: Gilraen was the wife of Arathorn II and mother of Aragorn, the future King Elessar of the Reunited Kingdom.

name: Glirhuin
details: Glirhuin was an Edain Man of Brethil.

name: Gil-galad
details: Gil-galad, originally named Ereinion, was a Ñoldorin Elf and son to Fingon [note 1]. He was the last High King of the Ñoldor in Middle-earth, and bore many titles, including High King of the Elves of the West, King of the Eldar, King of Lindon, Lord of the High Elves, and the Lord of Eriador.

name: Gildor (Edain)
details: Gildor was an Edain of the House of Bëor and one of Barahir's Outlaws.

name: Gimilzagar
details: Gimilzagar was a Númenórean of the royal house of Elros.

name: Gethron
details: Gethron was an Edain of Hurin's household during the First Age. He and his companion Grithnir were best known for serving as escorts to the young Túrin on his journey to Doriath.

name: Gilfanon
details: Gilfanon was a Ñoldor Elf of Tol Eressëa.

name: Hamfast Gardner
details: Hamfast Gardner was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Gildis
details: Gildis was an Edain woman of the House of Hador.

name: Gilmith
details: Gilmith was the daughter of Imrazôr, a man of Númenórean descent, and Mithrellas, a Silvan Elf-maiden who accompanied Nimrodel before getting lost. Imrazôr took her in, they married and had two children, Gilmith and Galador. Mithrellas later ran away and was never seen again. Galador would later become the first Prince of Dol Amroth.[2]

name: Ghân-buri-Ghân
details: Ghân-buri-Ghân was the chief of the Drúedain living in the Drúadan Forest in the latter half of the Third Age.

name: Gandalf
details: Gandalf (Norse; IPA: [gand:alf] - "Elf of the Wand" or "Wand-elf") the Grey, later known as Gandalf the White, and originally named Olórin (Quenya; IPA: [oˈloːrin] - "Dreamer" or "Of Dreams"), was an Istar (wizard), sent by the West in the Third Age to combat the threat of Sauron. He joined Thorin and his company to reclaim the Lonely Mountain from Smaug, convoked the Fellowship of the Ring to destroy the One Ring, and led the Free Peoples in the final campaign of the War of the Ring.

name: Gelmir
details: Gelmir was a Ñoldorin Elf of Nargothrond; son of Guilin and brother of Gwindor.

name: Gelmir (of Angrod's kin)
details: Gelmir was Ñoldor Elf of the First Age.

name: Elanor Gardner
details: Elanor Gardner (née Gamgee or Fairbairn), or Elanor the Fair, known affectionately by her father as Elanorellë, was the first daughter of Samwise Gamgee and Rosie Cotton.

name: Gamil Zirak
details: Gamil Zirak was a Dwarvish smith, who was the master of Telchar of Nogrod in the early First Age. Gamil was a great craftsman, whose work was found in the treasuries of Elu Thingol. He was commonly referred to as "the old"; Zirak the Old.

name: Samwise Gamgee
Gamling
details: Gamling was a Man of Rohan sometimes known as "Gamling the Old" referenced in The Two Towers and the Return of the King.

name: Primrose Gardner
details: Primrose Gardner was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: May Gamgee
details: May Gamgee was born in TA 2976 (SR 1376) and was the fourth child and the second daughter of Hamfast Gamgee and Bell Goodchild of Bagshot Row in Hobbiton. Her youngest brother was Samwise Gamgee. She also had three older siblings: Hamson, Halfred, and Daisy, and a younger sister Marigold.

name: Hamfast Gamgee
details: Hamfast was the son of Hobson "Roper" Gamgee. He married Bell Goodchild, with whom he had six children, including Samwise Gamgee, his youngest son. He was a gardener on the Baggins property at Bag End for many years. He was frequently consulted for his knowledge of root vegetables (generally over a pint at the local inn), and was seen as a particular authority on the growing of potatoes. As the time of Bilbo Baggins's birthday party drew near, he was also in demand for his stories of Bilbo and his family. He didn't particularly like Sandyman the miller.

name: Daisy Gamgee
details: Daisy was born in TA 2972 (SR 1372) and had two older brothers: Hamson and Halfred. She also had three younger siblings: May, Samwise, and Marigold. Samwise would later on become one of the greatest Hobbits in the history of Middle-earth.[1]

name: Frodo Gardner
details: Frodo Gardner, also known as Frodo Gamgee, was the son of Samwise Gamgee and Rosie Gamgee. He was named after Frodo Baggins, and took the last name of Gardner after his father became the Shire's gardener. He owned Bag End for a time.

name: Halfast Gamgee
details: Called "Hal" as a nickname, Halfast was born in TA 2972 (SR 1372) to Halfred Gamgee of Overhill and was Sam's cousin. He was known to have worked for the Boffin family as a hunter.

name: Halfred Gamgee
details: Halfred Gamgee was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Ilmarë
details: Ilmarë (Quenya; IPA: [ˈilmare] - "Starlight") was chief amongst the Maiar and the handmaiden to Queen Varda.[1]

name: Hamson Gamgee
details: Hamson Gamgee was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Galdor of the Havens
details: Galdor was an Elf of the Grey Havens.

name: Galathil
details: Galathil was a Sindarin elf of Doriath.

name: Galdor
details: Galdor was a Man of Dor-lómin of the House of Hador (Third House of the Edain) during the First Age.

name: Galar
details: Galar was a Dwarf who lived in Nordinbad as a merchant, during the Third Age. He was the steward of Gorin.

name: Galdor of the Tree
details: Galdor was an Elf of Gondolin during the First Age.

name: Galion
details: Galion was a Nandorin Wood-elf of the Woodland Realm in Northern Mirkwood.

name: Galador
details: According to legend, Galador was the half-elven son of Imrazôr the Númenórean and the Elf-maid Mithrellas.[1] Following the drowning of Amroth, the seat of the Princes of Belfalas was renamed in his honour. Galador founded Dol Amroth and became its first Prince, his ancestors having held the title "Prince" since the time of Elendil and ruling Belfalas at least as long.[2]

name: Fíriel
details: Fíriel was a Queen of Arnor and the wife of Arvedui, the last King of Arthedain.

name: Galadhon
details: Galadhon was a Sindar Elf of Doriath.

name: Frór
details: Frór (TA 2552 – TA 2589) was a dwarf of the Grey Mountains (Ered Mithrin) and was of the line of Durin.

name: Fíriel Fairbairn
details: Fíriel Fairbairn (b. Early FO ?) was the daughter of Elanor Gardner and Fastred of Greenholm. She was one of the Fairbairns of Undertowers, the Warden of Westmarch.

name: Fëanor
details: Fëanor was a Ñoldorin elf and one of the Elven kindred that departed from Valinor in the land of Aman, where they had lived with the Valar.

name: Fréawine
details: Fréawine was the fifth King of Rohan.

name: Fundin
details: Fundin was the son of Farin, the brother of Gróin, father of Balin and Dwalin, and uncle of Óin and Gloin, four of Thorin Oakenshield's companions on the Quest of Erebor.

name: Fuinur
details: Fuinur was a Black Númenórean lord.

name: Frerin
details: Frerin was a Dwarf of Durin's Folk.

name: Fréaláf Hildeson
details: Fréaláf Hildeson was the tenth King of Rohan, and the first king of the second line.

name: Fréa
details: Fréa was the fourth King of Rohan.

name: Frár
details: Frár is a dwarf of Durin's Folk that colonized in Moria during Third Age

name: Freca
details: Freca (TA 2698 - TA 2754) was a lord of western Rohan who was best known for challenging Helm Hammerhand, the King of Rohan.

name: Forlong
details: Forlong also known as Forlong the Fat and Forlong the Old, was a Man of Gondor from the province of Lossarnach, south of the White Mountains.

name: Frumgar
details: Frumgar was the fourth Lord of the Éothéod and the ancestor of Eorl the Young.

name: Folcred
details: Folcred was one of the twin sons of King Folcwine.

name: Fram
details: Fram was the son of Frumgar and the fourth Lord of the Éothéod.

name: Forweg
details: Forweg was an Edain of the House of Hador and the original leader of the outlaw company known as 'the Gaurwaith'.

name: Folcwine
details: Folcwine was the fourteenth King of Rohan.

name: Fortinbras Took I
details: Fortinbras Took I was a Thain of the Shire.

name: Fladrif
details: Fladrif, also known as Skinbark, was an ent of Fangorn Forest, and was one of the first Ents in Middle-earth. By the end of the Third Age, only he, Leaflock, and Treebeard remained of the original Ents.[1]

name: Finrod
details: Finrod, also known fully as Finrod Felagund, was a Ñoldorin Elf who was born in Aman, He was King of Nargothrond and the eldest son of Finarfin and Eärwen, and the brother of Galadriel, Angrod and Aegnor.[2] Finrod was one of the noblest elves of the House of Finarfin and a friend of Men. His nobility and death saving Beren and his opposition to the Oath of Fëanor allowed for his return to life in Valinor, making him the first Elf to be reincarnated in the Undying Lands before the end of the First Age.

name: Flói
details: Flói was a Dwarf of unknown lineage.

name: Fingon
details: Fingon the "Valiant" was an Ñoldorin Elf, the eldest son of Fingolfin, and older brother of Turgon, Aredhel, and Argon.[1]

name: Fingolfin
details: Fingolfin was the second High King of the Ñoldor in Beleriand; the Ñoldor being one of the three branches of Elves. He was the eldest son of Finwë and Indis, younger brother of Findis, older brother of Irimë and Finarfin, and the younger half-brother of Fëanor. He founded the House of Fingolfin, which ruled the Ñoldor in Middle-earth. His wife was Anairë and his children were Fingon, Turgon, Aredhel, and Argon. Fingolfin was said to be the strongest, most steadfast, and most valiant of Finwë's sons.[3]

name: Fire-drake of Gondolin
details: He arrived over the western walls of Gondolin, carrying Balrogs upon his back. During the ensuing chaos, Ecthelion and Tuor were confronted by the Urulóki and it almost trampled on them. Tuor then hewed the foot of the beast. The fire-drake was said to have sprouted flames and screamed, and he lashed his tail and killed many Orcs and Gondothlim in his agony. Thus, Tuor and Ecthelion were able to escape the beast.[1] It is possible that this dragon is the grandfather of the mighty Smaug.

name: Finwë
details: Finwë was the first High King of the Ñoldor who led his people on the journey from Middle-earth to Valinor in the blessed realm of Aman. He was a great friend of Elu Thingol, the King of Doriath. He was the father of Fëanor, Fingolfin, Finarfin, Írimë, and Findis. As founder of the House of Finwë, he and his first and second wives were the sires of the three noble houses of Fëanor, Fingolfin, Finarfin who afterwards ruled great realms in Middle-earth, and succeeded him in Aman. His bloodline also mixed its way into the race of Men as well.

name: Forthwini
details: Forthwini was the son of Marhwini and the second Lord of the Éothéod.

name: Finarfin
details: Finarfin was a Ñoldorin Elf of Valinor.

name: Folca
details: Folca, also known as the Hunter, was the thirteenth King of Rohan.

name: Finglas
details: Finglas was one of three oldest Ents still living during the end of the Third Age. He, Skinbark, and Treebeard were the only ones left of the first and eldest of the Ents in Middle-earth. By the time of the War of the Ring, Finglas had become sleepy and "treeish" (dormant and inanimate, like a tree). He stood alone in a meadow and dozed during the summer. At first he would awake in wintertime, but eventually he remained in place year-round, preferring to remain dormant to avoid the troubles of the world.[1]

name: Findis
details: Findis was Ñoldor elf, the daughter of Finwë, the High King of the Ñoldor and Indis; sister of Fingolfin and Finarfin and half-sister of Fëanor.

name: Finduilas
details: Finduilas was a Ñoldor Elf princess of the First Age, the daughter of Orodreth, ruler of the hidden realm of Nargothrond, niece of Galadriel and sister of Gil-galad.

name: Finduilas of Dol Amroth
details: Finduilas was the sister of Prince Imrahil of Dol Amroth, the late wife of Denethor II, and the mother of Boromir and Faramir.

name: Fimbrethil
details: Fimbrethil was Treebeard's long-lost wife.

name: Bill Ferny
details: Bill Ferny was a Man of Bree and a known agent of Saruman before and during the War of the Ring.

name: Fengel
details: Fengel was the fifteenth King of Rohan.

name: Fastred (Pelennor Fields)
details: Fastred was a Man of Rohan.

name: Fellowship members
details: The members of the Fellowship of the Ring (including all of the members of the Nine Walkers, and The members of the Fellowship's reinforcements led by Berethor, Commander of the Soldiers of Minas Tirith.

name: Findegil
details: Findegil was a Man of Gondor that lived during the Fourth Age.

name: Ferumbras Took II
details: Ferumbras Took II was a Thain of the Shire.

name: Farin
details: Farin was a Dwarf of the line of Durin's Folk.

name: Fastred of Greenholm
details: Fastred of Greenholm was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Faramir (son of Ondoher)
details: Faramir was the second son of King Ondoher of Gondor.

name: Óin
details: Óin was a Dwarf of Durin's Folk known for being a part of Thorin and Company during the Quest of Erebor.

name: Fastred
details: Fastred was a man of Rohan and one of the twin sons of King Folcwine, brother of Folcred. He had a younger brother Fengel and an unnamed sister.

name: Òmar
details: Òmar also known as Amillo[1] was a Valar in the earlier forms of the legendarium.

name: Fastolph Bolger
details: Fastolph Bolger was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Falathar
details: Falathar was a faithful friend of Eärendil, and one of the three mariners who accompanied him on his voyages on the high seas west of Middle-earth.

name: Írimë
details: Írimë was a Ñoldor Elf, the daughter of Finwë, the High King of the Ñoldor and Indis; sister of Fingolfin, Finarfin, Findis, and half-sister of Fëanor.

name: Éomund
details: Éomund was the Chief Marshal of the Mark of Rohan under Théoden King in the years leading up to the War of the Ring. He was also the father of Éomer and Éowyn, and the husband of Théodwyn, sister of Théoden. Éomund was a distant descendant of Éofor, one of the sons of Brego, son of Eorl.

name: Írildë
details: Írildë was a Woman of Númenór.

name: Îbal
details: Îbal was a Númenórean child.

name: Éofor
details: Éofor was a Prince of Rohan, the third son of Brego, who was the second King of Rohan.

name: Witch-king of Angmar
details: The Witch-king of Angmar was the leader of the Nazgûl or Ringwraiths, and Sauron's second-in-command during the Second and Third Ages. Once a king of men, possibly of Númenórean heritage, he was corrupted by one of the nine Rings of Power that had been given to the lords of men, becoming a wraith in the service of Sauron.

name: Yavanna
details: Yavanna (Quenya; IPA: [jaˈvanna] - "Giver of Fruits") was of the Ainur and Valar, and one of the Aratar who was responsible for the growth of all the fruits and growing things of Arda. She was also called Kementári (Quenya; IPA: "Queen of the Earth"), Ivon (Sindarin; IPA: "Giver of Fruits"). She resided in the Pastures of Yavanna, in the south of Valinor.[1]

name: Wídfara
details: Wídfara was a Man of Rohan during the War of the Ring.

name: Wulf I
details: Wulf I was a Dunlending lord who, for a short period of time, ruled Rohan.

name: Will Whitfoot
details: Will Whitfoot was the Mayor of Michel Delving at the time of the War of the Ring. He was said to be the fattest hobbit in the Westfarthing. On one occasion the roof of the Town Hole collapsed, covering Will in chalk and earning him the nickname 'Flourdumpling'.

name: Yávien
details: Yávien was a noblewoman of Númenor.

name: Zamîn
details: Zamîn was an old woman of Númenór who served Erendis, the wife of Tar-Aldarion.

name: Vána
details: Vána (Quenya; IPA: [ˈvaːna] - "Beautiful One") is an Ainu and a Valië who was responsible for the preserving of the youth made for all life in Arda. Among the seven Valier, Vána  was considered a rank of six of the Queens of the Valar.[1] She was sister of Yavanna and wife of Orome, and is possibly related to Melian. She was also known as "Vána the Ever-Young".

name: Vëantur
details: Vëantur was the Númenórean captain of the royal fleet of Tar-Elendil. He was likewise grandfather of Tar-Aldarion. Vëantur was also the commander of the first ship that returned to Middle-earth.

name: Wilcombe Cotton
details: Wilcombe Cotton, more commonly known as "Will", was a Hobbit of the Shire and a member of the Cotton family.

name: Wife of Barach
details: The Wife of Barach befriended the Drug tribesman Aghan. She lived with her husband and children at the edge of the Forest of Brethil. It was attacked by orcs but reclaimed by Aghan.

name: Wiseman Gamwich
details: Wiseman Gamwich was a Hobbit of the Shire.

name: Widow Rumble
details: Widow Rumble was a servant, or nurse, to Hamfast Gamgee as he became of age after the War of the Ring in number three Bagshot Row, at which time Samwise moved into Bag End.[1]

name: Voronwë
details: Voronwë, also called Aranwion, was a Ñoldorin Elf mariner from Gondolin who was one of a crew of several ships sent by Turgon to solicit aid from the Valar. The Doom of Mandos, however, made any such attempt futile, and Voronwë was the only one to survive.[2]

name: Walda
details: Walda was the twelfth King of Rohan.

name: Vorondil
details: Vorondil, also known as Vorondil the Hunter, was the Steward to the King Eärnil II of Gondor.

name: Varda
details: Varda (Quenya; IPA: [ˈvarda] - "Sublime" or "Lofty") was an Ainu, and one of the Aratar and a Vala responsible for the outlining of the stars in the heavens above Arda. She was also known as Elbereth (Sindarin; IPA: "Queen of the Stars"), Tintallë (The Kindler), or Gilthoniel, and was the spouse of Manwë, with whom she lived in Ilmarin on the summit of Taniquetil in Aman.

name: Vëannë
details: Vëannë (named Melinir by Eriol) was a child who resided at the Cottage of Lost Play in Tol Eressëa.[1]

name: Villains
details: All items (112)

name: Vidumavi
details: Vidumavi was a Northmen, the daughter of Vidugavia, the Princess of Rhovanion.

name: Valar Animals
details: There are a few "Vala animals" in J.R.R. Tolkien's works of Middle-earth, excluding magical creatures. They were powerful beings, usually sapient as of human intelligence or more, and were the sire of the race. Notable Vala Animals are:

name: Valandur
details: Valandur was the eighth King of Arnor.

name: Vidugavia
details: Vidugavia was a prince of the Northmen and was known as the King of Rhovanion, but was in fact only its mightiest prince.

name: Vardamir Nólimon
details: Vardamir Nólimon was the oldest child of Elros Tar-Minyatur, and the second King of Númenor.

name: Vardilmë
details: Vardilmë was the second child and only daughter of the short-reigning King Vardamir Nólimon.

name: Vairë
details: Vairë (Quenya; IPA: [ˈvaɪre] or [ˈwaɪre] - "Weaver") is an Ainu and Vala who was responsible for the weaving of the story of Arda.[1]

name: Valacar
details: Valacar (TA 1194 - TA 1432, r. TA 1366 - TA 1432) was the twentieth King of Gondor and the son of Rómendacil II, whom he succeeded in TA 1366.

name: Valandil
details: Valandil was the third King of Arnor.

name: Valandil of Andúnië
details: Valandil founded the line of the Lords of Andúnië in the western region of Andustar on Númenor.

name: Ungoliant
details: Ungoliant (Sindarin IPA: [uŋˈɡoljant] - "Dark Spider") was a primordial taking the shape of a gigantic spider. She was initially an ally of Melkor in Aman, and for a short time in Middle-earth as well. She was a distant mother of Shelob, and the oldest and first giant spider of Arda.

name: Ulrad
details: Ulrad was one of the men in the outlaw band led by Turin. He was a friend of the man that Turin killed to gain entry to the band. He contested Turin's right to be accepted into the outlaws. He is partly held responsible by Mim the petty dwarf for not being able to speak to his so before he died because Ulrad was one of the men that bound him. Ulrad's fate is not revealed after this.

name: Urthel
details: Urthel was an Edain of the House of Bëor and one of Barahir's Outlaws.

name: Vairë (Elf)
details: Vairë was an Elf of Tol Eressëa and one of the keepers of the Cottage of Lost Play.

name: Ulfast
details: Ulfast was an Easterling of the First Age.

name: Ulfang
details: Ulfang, also known as Ulfang the Black, was the Easterling chieftain of the First Age who followed Caranthir to the Nirnaeth Arnoediad, but betrayed the Sons of Fëanor and gave Morgoth victory.

name: Uldor
details: Uldor was an Easterling Man the youngest son of Ulfang the Black.

name: Ulwarth
details: Ulwarth was an Easterling Man and the son of Ulfang.

name: Ulmo
details: Ulmo (Quenya; IPA: [ˈulmo] - "Pourer" or "Rainer") - also known as Ulubôz or Ullubôz - was an Ainu, one of the Aratar, and the Vala responsible for the control over the oceans of Arda. A lover of water, Ulmo was one of the Arda's chief architects and was always in a close friendship with Manwë. He always distrusted Melkor, and the Dark Lord feared the Sea almost as much as he feared Varda because the sea cannot be tamed. Ulmo had no dwelling in Valinor or any permanent dwelling on land, as he preferred the deeps of the seas and the rivers. His palace, on the bottom of Vaiya, was called Ulmonan.

name: Uinen
details: Uinen (Sindarin; IPA: [ˈuɪnen] - "Ever Water") was a Maia spirit known as The Lady of the Sea and the wife of the Maia Ossë. She was a matron to all mariners.

name: Túrin
details: Túrin Turambar was an Adan of the House of Hador and a Man of Middle-earth, who became a tragic hero (or anti-hero) of the First Age, in the tale called Narn i Chîn Húrin ("The Tale of the Children of Húrin").

name: Uin
details: Uin was a great whale that served Ulmo, being entitled as the primeval whale or Gulma's great whale, with Gulma being an earlier name for Ulmo[1], or oldest of the Right Whales.

name: Ufthak
details: Ufthak was a Mordor Orc serving in the Tower of Cirith Ungol.

name: Túrin II
details: Túrin II was the twenty-third Ruling Steward of Gondor.[2]

name: Daddy Twofoot
details: Daddy Twofoot was a Hobbit of the the Shire.

name: Ulbar
details: Ulbar was a Man of Númenór.

name: Turgon (Steward)
details: Turgon was the twenty-fourth Ruling Steward of Gondor.

name: Túrin I
details: Túrin I was the sixth Ruling Steward of Gondor.

name: Turgon
details: Turgon was a Ñoldorin Elf of Gondolin, second son of Fingolfin, brother of Fingon, Aredhel, Argon, and father of Idril. In Middle-earth, Turgon was the King of Gondolin and the High King of the Ñoldor. For hundreds of years of the First Age, Turgon remained successfully hidden from the eyes and ears of Morgoth until a betrayal from within caused his downfall.

name: Elwing
details: Elwing, also known as Elwing the White, was the daughter of Dior the Fair and his wife Nimloth. She was the younger sister of the twin brothers Eluréd and Elurín. She became the wife of Eärendil the Mariner, and was the mother of Elrond and Elros.

name: Enerdhil
details: Enerdhil was a possibly mythical jewel-smith of Gondolin.

name: Enel
details: Enel was an Elf of Cuiviénen.

name: Eradan
details: Eradan was the second Ruling Steward of Gondor.

name: Enelyë
details: Enelyë was an Elf of Cuiviénen.

name: Eluréd and Elurín
details: Eluréd and Elurín were the twin sons of Dior Eluchîl, son of Beren and Lúthien, and Dior's Elven wife, Nimloth.

name: Elros
details: In FA 532, Elros was born in Arvernien. In the assault of the Third Kinslaying by the Sons of Fëanor, Elros and Elrond were taken captive by Maglor and Maedhros. Later, Elwing, their mother, cast herself into the great Belegaer and vanished from Middle-earth.[3]

name: Emeldir
details: Emeldir was the wife of Barahir who was also of the House of Bëor through the line of Baran, the eldest son of Bëor the Old.[2] Emeldir then bore Barahir only one child and son who was none other than the renowned Beren Erchamion also known as Beren the One-handed. Thus, naming her son after her father Beren, Belemir's son.

name: Elmo
details: Elmo was the younger brother of Elwë and Olwë.

name: Elfwine
details: Elfwine was the son of Éomer and the nineteenth King of Rohan.

name: Elrond
Elphir
details: Elphir was the twenty-third Prince of Dol Amroth.

name: Elfhelm
details: Elfhelm was a noble man in Théoden's court, with the title of Marshal, in Rohan.

name: Elfhild
details: Elfhild was a to-be Queen of Rohan, the wife of King Théoden and the mother of Théodred.

name: Elf friends
details: For those who have been deemed Elf-friends by the Elves.

name: Elladan and Elrohir
details: In TA 2509, the brothers rescued their mother from her imprisonment with the Orcs. Although she was physically healed by Elrond, after fear and torment from the Orcs she lost all joy from Middle-earth, and so she departed for the Grey Havens the next year. Due to this, the twins harbored great hatred for Orcs.[4]

name: Elendur of Arnor
details: Elendur of Arnor was a Dúnedain of the North and the ninth King of Arnor.

name: Elendur
details: Elendur was the eldest son and apparent heir of Isildur, who fell along with two of his brothers at the Gladden Fields at the beginning of the Third Age.

name: Elendil
details: Elendil was born in 3119 of the Second Age in Númenor, son of Amandil, Lord of Andúnië and leader of the "Faithful" (those who remained loyal to the Valar), who maintained a strong friendship with the elves and preserved the old ways against the practices of Ar-Pharazôn and Sauron. He was married to an unnamed Númenórean woman no doubt of the same upbringing and noble blood to which they had two sons: Isildur and Anárion. It is not known whether she followed him to Middle-earth after the Fall of Númenor.[3]

name: Elemmírë (elf)
